overview_of_class: This class will explore the nature of race in an effort to understand exactly what race is. It seeks to understand why race is such a potent force in American society. Close attention will be paid to the relationship between race, power, and social stratification. The course will examine the nature of racial conflict and major efforts to combat racial inequality.
name: Race and Society
title: WCAS SOCIOL 208-0-20 Race and Society

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class will explore the nature of race in an effort to understand exactly what race is. It seeks to understand why race is such a potent force in American society. Close attention will be paid to the relationship between race, power, and social stratification. The course will examine the nature of racial conflict and major efforts to combat racial inequality.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: During preregistration, this course is only open to Sociology Majors & Minors. Registration will open to all undergraduates beginning Monday, February 22.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: This course is designed to enable students to think critically regarding race and its associated consequences. The purpose of the course is to make sure that students become familiar with the best sociological thinking on race. Its goal is to replace mythic inking about race with findings based on empirical research.
